sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Public Interest Attorney Assistance Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Public Interest Attorney Assistance Act.

sections.heading: Legislative findings. The General Assembly finds the following:
sections.text: Legislative findings. The General Assembly finds the following:

sections.heading: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to encourage qualified individuals to enter into and continue in employment in this State as assistant State's Attorneys, assistant Public Defenders, civil legal aid attorneys, assistant Attorneys General, assistant public guardians, IGAC  attorneys, and legislati
sections.text: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to encourage qualified individuals to enter into and continue in employment in this State as assistant State's Attorneys, assistant Public Defenders, civil legal aid attorneys, assistant Attorneys General, assistant public guardians, IGAC attorneys, and legislative attorneys in a manner that protects the rights of this State's most vulnerable citizens or promotes the quality enforcement of State law.

sections.heading: Definitions. For the purposes of this Act:
sections.text: Definitions. For the purposes of this Act:

sections.heading: Public Interest Attorney Loan Repayment Assistance Program.
sections.text: Public Interest Attorney Loan Repayment Assistance Program.

sections.heading: Ineligibility and termination of funds; procedures.
sections.text: Ineligibility and termination of funds; procedures.

sections.heading: Other powers.   The Commission  may make, enter into, and execute contracts, agreements, leases, and other instruments with any person, including without limitation any federal, State, or local governmental agency, and may take other actions that may be necessary or convenient to accomplish any purp
sections.text: Other powers. The Commission may make, enter into, and execute contracts, agreements, leases, and other instruments with any person, including without limitation any federal, State, or local governmental agency, and may take other actions that may be necessary or convenient to accomplish any purpose authorized by this Act.
